content.description: Good hand crack on a dihedral leads to off width as you climb higher. Crux comes as you change from hands or lie back to offwidth. I found this climb in an old book that called it 5.9. However, after climbing it felt much softer.
content.protection: .75 to 4 Bolt at top need replacing set up anchor with two #2 Cams in flake on opposite side of rock. Belay from top
content.location: Continue below Out of Sight. You will see a short wide crack on a wide large boulder. The climb is on the north side of the boulder. You can see out of sight clearly from the top of the boulder. easy down climb from the south side of boulder

content.description: This is one of the longest routes on Woodson.  Start at the obvious flake and bust 5.10/+ lieback moves up to where the flake seams out.  Switch techniques and use delicate or powerful face moves past 3 bolts (crux).
content.protection:
Thin gear that would most likely blow the flake off and 3 bolts.

3 bolts on top for TR also.
content.location: Walk down past the Out of Sight boulder another 100 yards on the most obvious trail.  This trail trends northeast and downhill.  The PhD boulder will be on the north side of the trail (to your left).  You will walk past a boulder with an obvious OW on your left first.  The next boulder is the PhD boulder walk on top to set up a TR.  PhD is on the North side.

content.description: On the east or bottom side of Out of Sight boulder is this Woodson classic. Crux comes at the bottom of the climb funky offwidth lead to slightly big hands. The climb is longer than it looks from the ground. I have seen Out of Sihgt rated 5.10a in some guide books. However it is a 5.9 and protects well.
content.protection: Use a #3 or 4 at bottom crux. A #2 fits great as you go to hands. Two # 3's will get you to the top of the crack. Gear anchor using mid size cams in the Horizantal crack at top of climb. Walk off back of boulder.
content.location: Two turns before top of hill there is a climbers trail to the east side of the road. Trail starts in a big open area take trail 2 hundred yards down and look for a giant Boulder balanced on top of a flat Boulder with kerns next to it. Boulderleft side of that trail.

content.description:
Number 241 in the Kennedy guide, rated 5.10+, not by me. I'd say its maybe 5.10-.

A fine arete. Do some lie-backing, slapping of the corner and a little bit of giddy-upping. Slab skills won't hurt here (when do they hurt?). The flake at the start is about as solid as a creme-brulee, so pull gently.
content.protection: Clip a series of bolts to the top, there's a ground-fall potential runout to the second bolt, which coincides with the flexing flake, hence the pg-13 rating.
content.location: Continue below Out of Sight. You will see a short wide crack on a wide large boulder. The climb is on the north side of the boulder, TO THE LEFT OF THE BIG OLD DIHEDRAL. You can see out of sight clearly from the top of the boulder. easy down climb from the south side of boulder.
